intro: Pseudabutilon aristulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved false abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
